description: A UROP involves the student working with a supervisor, and usually in a team, on an existing research project, and involves the application of subject knowledge, methodology and theory in reflection upon the research project. UROPs may be with USP faculty, joint appointees, or other NUS faculty and, exceptionally, with other USP partners. All are vetted and approved by the USP, and are assessed. UROPs are proposed by a supervisor, and require the approval of the USP.
title: USP Undergraduate Research Opportunity (S&T-based UROP)
